issues.title: Missing Notification Requirements for Out-of-Authorization Assignments
issues.description: Education Code 44258.3 requires specific notification procedures when teachers are assigned to departmentalized classes outside their credential authorization. While the AR mentions notification to the exclusive representative, both documents are missing the required notification to the County Superintendent and the Commission on Teacher Credentialing.

legal_citations.text: The employing agency shall notify the county superintendent of schools and the commission of any assignment made pursuant to this section.

issues.required_language: When a teacher is assigned to teach departmentalized classes outside their credential authorization pursuant to Education Code 44258.3, the Superintendent or designee shall notify the County Superintendent of Schools and the Commission on Teacher Credentialing of such assignment.

issues.title: Missing Annual Board Resolution Requirement
issues.description: While the BP mentions that assignments outside credential authorization "shall be annually approved by Board resolution," there are no procedures in the AR for implementing this requirement, including timing, documentation, or process details.

legal_citations.text: Assignment pursuant to this section shall be made only with the written consent of the employee and shall be annually approved by resolution of the governing board of the school district.

issues.required_language: The Superintendent or designee shall prepare an annual resolution for Board approval that identifies all teachers assigned outside their credential authorization. The resolution shall be presented to the Board no later than [specific date] each year and shall include the name of each teacher, their credential authorization, the assignment made, and the legal basis for the assignment.

issues.title: Missing Written Consent Requirement
issues.description: Education Code requires written consent from teachers for out-of-authorization assignments. While the BP mentions "with the teacher's consent," neither document specifies that this consent must be in writing or includes procedures for obtaining and documenting such consent.

legal_citations.text: Assignment pursuant to this section shall be made only with the written consent of the employee

issues.required_language: Before assigning a teacher to teach departmentalized classes outside their credential authorization, the Superintendent or designee shall obtain the teacher's written consent. The written consent shall be maintained in the teacher's personnel file and shall specify the assignment, duration, and legal authorization.

issues.title: Outdated Administrative Regulation
issues.description: The AR was last reviewed in 2009, while the BP was updated in 2024. This creates potential inconsistency and suggests the AR may not reflect current legal requirements or district practices.

legal_citations.text: Governing boards must ensure policies and regulations are current and legally compliant

issues.required_language: The Administrative Regulation should be reviewed and updated to ensure alignment with the current Board Policy and applicable legal requirements.
